guide.introduction: This fume extractor is based on the mini fume extractor that was made by Marc de Vinck. This is basically a fume extractor mounted onto a third-hand tool. In other words, this is just a thing you can do with the mini fume extractor. If you want a fume extractor to be 1-5 inches away from something then this is a perfect solution.
guide.introduction_rendered:
This fume extractor is based on the mini fume extractor that was made by Marc de Vinck. This is basically a fume extractor mounted onto a third-hand tool. In other words, this is just a thing you can do with the mini fume extractor. If you want a fume extractor to be 1-5 inches away from something then this is a perfect solution.

Relevant parts
  • 7812 Voltage Regulator
  • SPST toggle switch
  • Computer fan, 5-8 inches square
  • 9 Volt alkaline battery
  • 9v battery snap
  • Carbon filter pack, 5-8 inches square
  • (optinal) Fan guard, 5-8 inches square
  • 22 awg wire
  • Heat shrink tubing, 6"
  • Third-hand tool aka helping hands RS#: 64-079
Tools
  • Drill and 1/2" bit
  • Hot Glue gun & hot glue
  • Soldering Iron and rosin core solder

parts.text: Third-hand tool aka helping hands RS#: 64-079

lines.text: Follow the instructions on MakeProjects to make a mini fume extractor. Just replace the 40mm fan with the 5-8 inch fan.
lines.text_raw: Follow the instructions on MakeProjects to make a [guide|21|mini fume extractor]. Just replace the 40mm fan with the 5-8 inch fan.

lines.text: Drill a 1/2 inch or similar hole in the fan. That is where I am going to attach it to the helping hands.
lines.text_raw: Drill a 1/2 inch or similar hole in the fan. That is where I am going to attach it to the helping hands.

lines.text: In my case, my helping hands came with a magnifying glass, so I had to remove that. Once you remove that, you can fit the fan through the hole. Once you're done with that, you are going to glue on the fan to make it secure.
lines.text_raw: In my case, my helping hands came with a magnifying glass, so I had to remove that. Once you remove that, you can fit the fan through the hole. Once you're done with that, you are going to glue on the fan to make it secure.

lines.text: The carbon filters need to be 5 inches to 8 inches. Once  you've cut the filter, you are going to glue it on the side where the air rushes out.
lines.text_raw: The carbon filters need to be 5 inches to 8 inches. Once  you've cut the filter, you are going to glue it on the side where the air rushes out.

lines.text: Turn on the fan, heat up some solder, and let the fumes get absorbed. You will need to change the carbon filters once every 3 months, or when the filter gets all dirty. Happy Making!
